pli-tv-pvr2.2:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr2.2:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr2.2:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr2.2:1.1: (5) When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, how many kinds of offences does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.2:1.2: She commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:1.3: when she consents to him taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:1.4: when she consents to him taking hold of her above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:1.5: when she consents to him taking hold of something connected to her body, she commits an offence of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:2.1: (6) When a nun who conceals offenses conceals an offense, how many kinds of offences does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.2:2.2: She commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:2.3: when she knowingly conceals an offense entailing expulsion, she commits an offense involving expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:2.4: when, being unsure, she conceals it, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:2.5: when she conceals a failure in conduct, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:3.1: (7) When a nun takes sides with one who has been ejected and does not stop when pressed up to the third time, how many kinds of offences does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.2:3.2: She commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:3.3: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:3.4: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:3.5: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:4.1: (8) When fulfilling the eight parts, how many kinds of offences does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.2:4.2: She commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:4.3: when she goes to such-and-such a place when told by a man to do so, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:4.5: when she enters within arm’s reach of the man, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:4.6: when she fulfills the eight parts, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:5.1: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr2.2:6.1: (1) When a litigious nun initiates a lawsuit, she commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:6.2: when she tells one other person, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:6.3: when she tells a second person, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:6.4: when the lawsuit is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:7.1: (2) When giving the full admission to a female criminal, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:7.2: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:7.3: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:7.4: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:8.1: (3) When walking alone to the next village, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:8.2: when she is in the process of going, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:8.3: when she goes beyond the boundary with the first foot, she commits a serious  offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:8.4: when she goes beyond with the second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:9.1: (4) When reinstating—without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group—a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule and the Monastic Law and the Teacher’s instruction, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:9.2: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:9.3: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:9.4: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:10.1: (5) When a lustful nun eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from the hands of a lustful man, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:10.2: when she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:10.3: for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:10.4: when she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:11.1: (6) When urging a nun on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself and then eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you,” she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:11.3: when, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:11.4: for every mouthful, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:11.5: when the meal is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:12.1: (7) When an angry nun does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:12.2: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:12.3: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:12.4: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:13.1: (8) When a nun who has had a legal issue decided against her does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:13.2: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:13.3: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:13.4: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:14.1: (9) When socializing nuns do not stop when pressed up to the third time, they commit three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:14.2: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:14.3: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:14.4: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:15.1: (10) When urging a nun on, saying, “Venerables, you should socialize; don’t live separately;” and not stopping when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:15.3: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:15.4: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:15.5: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:16.1: The offenses entailing suspension are finished.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:17.1: (1) When collecting bowls, she commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:17.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:18.1: (2) When determining out-of-season robe-cloth as “in-season”, and then sharing it out, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:18.2: when she is in the process of sharing it out, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:18.3: when she has shared it out, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:19.1: (3) When swapping robes with a nun and then just taking it back, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:19.2: when she is in the process taking it back, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:19.3: when she has taken it back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:20.1: (4) When asking for one thing and then for something else, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:20.2: when she is in the process of asking, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:20.3: when she has asked, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:21.1: (5) When getting one thing in exchange and then something else, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:21.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:21.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:22.1: (6) When exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that is designated for a specific purpose, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:22.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:22.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:23.1: (7) When exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:23.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:23.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:24.1: (8) When exchanging for something else a collective requisite that is designated for a specific purpose, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:24.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:24.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:25.1: (9) When exchanging for something else a collective requisite that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:25.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:25.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:26.1: (10) When exchanging for something else a personal requisite that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:26.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:26.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:27.1: (11) When getting in exchange a heavy cloak worth more than four _kaṁsa_ coins, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:27.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:27.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:28.1: (12) When getting in exchange a light cloak worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:28.2: when she is in the process of getting it in exchange, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:28.3: when she has received it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:29.1: The rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:30.0.1: 4. The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-pvr2.2:30.1: (1) When eating garlic, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:30.2: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:30.3: for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:31.1: (2) When removing hair from the private parts, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:31.2: when she is in the process of removing it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:31.3: when , she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.2:32.1: (3) When  , she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:32.2: when she is in the process of , the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.2:33.1: (4) When  , she commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.2:40.1: The first sub-chapter on garlic is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.2:41.1: (11) When standing alone with a man in the dark of the night without a lamp, she commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.2:41.2: when she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr2.2:41.3: when , she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
